name: places/ChIJbz0iOp1bwokR5duVkhyBKF4
formattedAddress: 96 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 96 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA

originalText.text: Came here for a drinks and pizza, sat at the bar. It was some of the worst service we have had in a long time. The bartender was not engaging. It took him nearly 10 mins just to acknowledge us. Once our pizza came, we sat there for another 10 mins waiting on napkins, silverware, and plates. I had to complain to the manager just to get some.

I had to complain to the manager just to get some.

originalText.text:
We live in the neighborhood and have been been going to the Tin Building since they opened last year. The bakery downstairs and pizza and pasta from Frenchman's Dough at the Cocktail Bar are among our favorites. Unfortunately the level of service has gone down hill from when we first started going. We decided to go in last night around 10:00pm and have some cocktails and a pizza. When we arrived we were met with an absolutely miserable bartender who could barely smile or talk and had an attitude as though she was doing us a favor by serving us. The bar was filthy and had not been wiped clean from the previous guests and there was no one else there. So she wasn't busy. After ordering we told her she could give us the check as they were closing at 10:30 so she could get settled up as a courtesy. And her reply was "it's last call anyway". After settling up and giving her more than a twenty percent tip (which she did not deserve) she left our dirty dishes on the bar and finally a manager, who was very nice, came over to cleanup the mess after noticing the bartender wasn't doing it.

When we first started going there was a wonderful bartender, Sam, who we loved. We went in every week when he was there and go to see him where he currently working. No surprise he didn't stay there with how this place is run. It seems as though now there is a new bartender every time we go in and a revolving door of employees who clearly do not want to be there.

As a chef and someone who has worked in the industry for 35 plus years, it is extremely disappointing to have this kind of service. The food is great from Frenchman's Dough but it is hard to enjoy when the service is so bad.

The bakery downstairs now never seems to have a supply of anything we like and by mid afternoon they are completely sold out and the black and white cookies we bought last time were stale. All very surprising for a Jean Georges location and I would certainly expect more from a place with his name on it. There seems to be a problem with management, staff and training. This place will not be around long if it continues down this path I am sorry to say.
